intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: Which Greek Life organization celebrated its 10-year anniversary last weekend?
questions.explanation: BOX — a Brown-based Black fraternity founded in September 2013 — welcomed affiliated alumni and current undergraduates to commemorate  its 10-year anniversary on campus during Black Alumni Weekend. BOX is an anti-hazing and philanthropic organization and serves 18 undergraduate members.

questions.question: What was the final score of the Brown-Penn Football Game last Friday?
questions.explanation: Last Friday, the Bears (4-3, 2-2 Ivy) beat Penn (5-2, 2-2 Ivy) 30-26 after a late-game interception by defensive back Isaiah Reed ’25. Last year, the Bears also won against the then-undefeated Quakers 34-31.

questions.question: What percent of students said they have been rejected from a club or student group at Brown?
questions.explanation: In The Herald’s fall 2023 poll, 48% of respondents said they’ve been rejected from a club or student group. The poll also asked students about support for student government and politicians, relationship status and more.

questions.question: What undergraduate was recently elected as UCS student activities chair?
questions.explanation: Kim was elected near-unanimously as UCS student activities chair after previously serving on the committee. Sarmas currently serves as UCS president; Frank is vice president. Sporn is Student Government Association elections chair.

questions.question: This weekend, the University dedicated the newly-renovated Churchill House. What department does it house?
questions.explanation: The University dedicated Churchill House, home to the Department of Africana Studies and Rites and Reason Theatre, during Black Alumni Reunion weekend. The building underwent a $20 million renovation that began in July 2022.

questions.question: What student group hosted their annual haunted house in Sayles Hall this weekend?
questions.explanation: This weekend, the Japanese Cultural Association transformed Sayles Hall into a haunted train station, as a part of their annual haunted house. The haunted house included a short movie and many decorated rooms filled with costumed JCA members.

questions.question: A special Rhode Island legislative commission held its second meeting on Oct. 24 to help address which species' population size?
questions.explanation: A new Rhode Island legislative committee has been formed to study the recent decrease in Narragansett Bay’s harvested quahogs, which is a clam species native to Rhode Island. The committee consists of 13 members from a variety of backgrounds.

questions.question: What two teams did women’s hockey beat this weekend at Meehan Stadium?
questions.explanation: This weekend, women’s hockey (3-3-0, 2-2-0 ECAC) bested Harvard (0-5-0, 0-5-0 ECAC) 2-1 and Dartmouth  (2-3-1, 1-3-1 ECAC) 7-1. The two wins help bring the Bears’ record to .500, giving them additional momentum as the season ramps up.

questions.question: What was the title of the first volume of the Brown Arts Institute’s MOVEMENTS arts journal?
questions.explanation: The inaugural volume of MOVEMENTS, entitled “Dissonance” launched online Friday. “Dissonance” seeks to activate “radical theoretical flows that reconnect us with each other, nature and the world” — and serves as a “poetic remixing of freedom movements and their live manifestations in community, experimentation and creativity,” according to the MOVEMENTS website.

questions.question: What School of Public Health center hosted a screening of the new documentary “Shot in the Arm” on Monday?
choices: Center for Alcohol and Addiction Studies
Center for Advancing Health Policy through Research
questions.explanation: The Pandemic Center hosted a screening of “Shot in the Arm” as a part of a year-long initiative to explore “storytelling as a public health intervention,” which will include workshops, campus conversations and film screenings.
